Detailed Description

Class representing a ground relation.

This class provides a way to represent a relation along with operations on it. In all the documentation of this class this refers to the represented relation. There are two basic notions attached to a relation:

  • Its arity that is the number of elements that each tuple in the relation has.
  • Its cardinality, which is the total number of tuple the relation contains.

\(arity(\text{this})\) and \(|\text{this}|\) denote resp. the arity and the cardinality of the represented relation.

Relations can be large but finite. The largest possible relation of arity \(n\) is \(\mathcal{U}_{n}=\mathcal{U}\times\ldots\times\mathcal{U}\). and \(\mathcal{U}=\{x: 0 \leq x \leq k\} \) for an arbitrary large \(k\).

Member Function Documentation

GRelation join ( int  j,
const GRelation &  r 
) const

Returns: \( \mathit{this}\;\bowtie_{j}\; r \).

This is, the result of joining the two relations on the j right most columns of this and the j left most columns of r.

GRelation permute ( const PermDescriptor &  desc) const

Computes the permutation of this according to desc.

Warning:
The permutation descriptor has to be valid for the relation. If it is not then a InvalidPermDescriptor exception is thrown.
GRelation project ( int  p) const

Returns: \( \Pi_{p} this \).

This is, the projection of this on the p rightmost columns.

Warning:
Throws an exception InvalidProjection if p is not a valid column in the relation.
GRelation timesU ( int  n,
bool  left 
) const

Computes the cross product of this with \( \mathcal{U}_n \).

As the cross product operation is not conmutative, the left parameter indicates whether to perform \( \mathcal{U}_n \times \mathrm{this}\) if left is true or \( \mathrm{this} \times \mathcal{U}_n\) otherwise.
